title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 326.4 - Withdrawal and refund of co-esc contributions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 326.4 - Withdrawal and refund of co-esc contributions

State Regulations

In the event of termination of employment other than as a
result of transfer to another public employer, a member participating in the
retirement plan provided for in article 14 of the Retirement and Social

Security Law, who is not vested or entitled to any other benefit under article
14, may withdraw his CO-ESC contributions and terminate his membership in the

New York State Employees' Retirement System by filing a form prescribed by the

Retirement System for this purpose. Such a request may be made after the member
has been separated from service for at least 15 days. The Retirement System
shall thereupon refund the CO-ESC contributions. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
326.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
